metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5249 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - untriaged.
metadata.Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Shaarli before 0.8.5 and 0.9.x before 0.9.3 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary code via the login form's username field (aka the login parameter to the ban_canLogin function in index.php).

criterions.comment: shaarli: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
